column4: Hey I am doing...    sudo bash ati-driver-installer-8.443.1-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
but it says no such file
where should it be? what dir?
when you run a bash command with sudo ... where should the file be?
so when I run that command... and it says file not found what do I do?
sudo bash ati-driver-installer-8.443.1-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
I run this command right here  :sudo bash ati-driver-installer-8.443.1-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
First, cd to the driectory where you saved the file.
cd Desktop
Sand then:  sh ./ati-driver-installer-8.42.3-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
No, just a terminal window
And then, cd to the Desktop directory:  cd Desktop
What is your "new problem"?
So, you are in console mode only?  Is that what you are saying.
Don't use gedit
sh ./ati-driver-installer-8.42.3-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
But first, what do you get when you type   pwd  ?
cd Desktop
NOW, what do you get when you type  pwd  ?
sh ./ati-driver-installer-8.42.3-x86.x86_64.run --buildpkg Ubuntu/gutsy
Is it working for you?
You'll do well to do a little research before shopping for hardware.
Nvidia would be a better choice, (for a Linux user.)
To tell the truth,  Nvidia has better driver software for both MS and Linux.
